intro: Dinteranthus vanzylii, commonly known as the Vanzylii dinteranthus, is a rare flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom during the cooler months. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-drained soil to thrive. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
